Caption: Figure 12: Illustration of our optimization for the Polonium algorithm: since we have a bipartite graph (of files and machines), the naive version leads to two independent but equivalent paths of propagation of messages (orange, and blue arrows). Eliminating one path saves us half of the computation and storage for messages, with no loss of accuracy.
